detaileddescription.para: Constructor.
Destructor.
Helper method for sending controlled shutdown requests to DBAppMgr.
This method shut down the system in a controlled manner.
This method is called when a new DBAppMgr is started.
This method is called when a BaseApp death dies.
This method returns the DBApp for the given address, or NULL if none exists.
This method returns the number of DBApps that have registered.
This method returns if the shard hash we have is usable.
This method returns whether the cluster is ready for database operation.
This method returns the start of the DBApps range.
This method returns the end of the DBApps range.
This method returns the Shard-Alpha, or NULL if there are no known shards (const version).
This method returns the DBApp Alpha for Shard-Alpha, or NULL if there are no DBApps registered (const version).
This method returns the DBApp Alpha for Shard-Alpha, or NULL if there are no DBApps registered.
This method returns the DBApp considered to be the least loaded.
This method notifies all interested processes that the cluster is ready for database operations.

parameterdescription.para: The auto loading status from alpha dbapps.

detaileddescription.para: This method handles the message from DBApp-Alpha confirming one-time initialisation has successfully completed or not.
This method is called when we receive notification from BaseAppMgr regarding the server startup status.
This method is used handle when we get notification about whether the rest of the server has started running.

parameterdescription.para: True if the server has started, otherwise, false.

memberdef.argsstring: (const StorageShardDescriptor &descriptor, DBAppID dbAppID, const Mercury::Address &dbAppAddress, bool hasConnectedToDB)
memberdef.name: recoverDBApp

detaileddescription.para: This method is used to recover the shard hash after DBAppMgr has restarted.

parameterdescription.para: The ID of a DBApp connected to that storage-shard.

detaileddescription.para: This method sends out the current DBApp hash state to all interested processes.
This method adds a storage shard to the system.

parameterdescription.para: The shard name, which should be unique in the cluster.
If non-NULL, then this should have human-readable result output to be displayed to the user.

detaileddescription.para: This method handles a request to persist a storage-shard addition completing.

parameterdescription.para: If true, then the persist operation succeeded, otherwise false.
The storage-shard that was to be added.

detaileddescription.para: This method retires a storage shard in the system.

parameterdescription.para: The name of the shard to retire

detaileddescription.para: This method handles a request to persist a storage-shard retirement completing.

parameterdescription.para: If true, then the persist operation succeeded, otherwise false.
The storage-shard that was to be retired.

detaileddescription.para: This method is called when a storage-shard with the given GUID has globally completed its transition, and this state has been persisted to the database.
This method is called when changes to the shard statuses have been persisted to the database, or when an attempt failed.

parameterdescription.para: True if the attempt succeeded, false otherwise.

detaileddescription.para: This method is called when the retry timer for persisting storage-shards statuses has expired.
This method handles the replies from the checkStatus requests.

This method handles an add message from a DBApp. It replies with the current DBApp hash with the new DBApp added. It may elect to wait some time to reply while it gathers up other DBApps that may have been added together, allowing for information for multiple DBApps to be aggregated into a single update.

parameterdescription.para: The message source, that is, the new DBApp address.

detaileddescription.para: This method handles a message from an already running DBApp to recover its state.
This method is called by machined to inform us of that a DBApp has died unexpectedly.
This method is called when a LoginApp dies.
This method handles BaseAppMgr being revived.
This method handles CellAppMgr being revived.
This method handles the registration of a new LoginApp.

parameterdescription.para: The message source, that is, the new LoginApp address.

detaileddescription.para: This method is called by each LoginApp when we are recovering to rebuild the LoginApp set.
This method handles a checkStatus request.
This method handles the storageShardsData message.
This is sent by DBApp-Alpha for Shard-Alpha with the shards info data read from the bigworldShardsInfo singleton table.
This method handles a message from DBApp notifying of the result of the initial connection attempt to the allocated shard's database.
This method handles a message sent from DBApps to indicate that a transfer cycle has completed successfully for a set of transition shards.
This method handles a message notifying us when changes to the shard statuses have been persisted to the database, or when an attempt failed.
This method returns the Shard-Alpha, or NULL if there are no known shards.
This method returns true if there is at least one storage-shard in transition.
This method initialises the shard configuration from bw.xml.
This method allocates a DBApp requesting registration to one of the available storage shards.

parameterdescription.para: The address of the new DBApp.

detaileddescription.para: This method returns the number of storage-shards that currently do not have any DBApps in their DBApp pool.
This method returns the number of storage-shards that currently do not have any connected DBApps.
This method sends a status check request to BaseAppMgr.
This method checks if the server should shut down.
This method initializes the shutdown process by sending BaseAppMgr a shutdown message.
This method sends controlled shutdown request to all DBapps.
This method sends controlled shutdown request to all LoginApps.
This method initializes the last LoginApp ID.
This method adds the watchers that are related to this object.
This method handles a DBApp dying unexpectedly.

parameterdescription.para: The address of the dead DBApp.

detaileddescription.para: This method adds a local transition completion notification for the given storage-shard GUID, from the given DBApp.
This method returns the storage-shard for the given GUID, or NULL if the GUID is invalid.

simplesect.para: The storage-shard with the given GUID, or NULL if no such storage-shard exists.

detaileddescription.para: This method checks the receipts and effects any transitions that are now globally completed.
This method checks the receipts and effects the adding transition for the given shard if it has been globally completed.

simplesect.para: true if the transition has globally completed, false otherwise.

detaileddescription.para: This method checks the receipts and effects the retiring transition for the given shard if it has been globally completed.

simplesect.para: true if the transition has globally completed, false otherwise.

detaileddescription.para: This method checks whether all shards in the cluster have finished auto-load.

simplesect.para: AUTO_LOAD_UNKNOWN if any shard has not finished auto-load; AUTO_LOAD_LOADED_SOME if all shards have finished auto-load and at least one shard has loaded something; AUTO_LOAD_LOADED_NONE if all shards have finished auto-load but no shard has loaded anything.

detaileddescription.para: This method returns true if, for a given transitioning storage-shard, for each DBApp in another given shard, a local transition completion notification has been received for that DBApp, and there has been at least one receipt received from a DBApp in that storage-shard.

parameterdescription.para: The storage-shard to check receipts from.

detaileddescription.para: This method handles a DBApp death with respect to the transition receipts by removing receipts from DBApps that will have have a new transfer cycle started in response to the DBApp death.
This class implements the main singleton object in the DBAppMgr application.
